xTo know

  • what is inside a solution file ?
  • what is inside an assembly file ? is it ILC or binary ?

  • What is CLR

    • common language runtime, anologues of JVM. It is the Just in time compiler that intreprets the intermediate level code into machine code. So any machine that has a CLR can run compiled .NET code (ILC)

  • What is assembly ?

    • analygous of Jar, contains runnable libs built from a project

  • Is assembly one per namespace ?

  • What is a solution file ? Is it suppose to be specific to a project ?

    • it can contain multiple project

  • What is ILC ?

    • intermediate language code, like bytecode C# is compiled to ILC and CLR interprets the ILC at runtime

  • What is the naming convention for constants in C# ?

    • Pascal case e.g. int MaxValueSalary = 20;

  • How to decalre a float variable in C# ?

    • float val = 0.2f; Just like java again

  • What is decimal type in C# ?

    • Float is 4 bytes, double is 8 bytes and decimal is 16 bytes representation of real numbers in C#

  • What is the naming convention for methods in C# ?

    • PascalCase unlike camel case in Java

  • Just like packages in Java, are namespace cosntrained by dir structure from project root ?

    • No, name space are independent from dir structure

  • What are virtual methods ?

    • in C#, overriding depends on the type of reference teh variable holds. Unlike java, a supser class reference can also inovke overriden version of method, , if super class declares the methods using virtual keyword

  • Just like java.lang names space, System name space is auto imported in C#. True/False ?

    • In C# we have to explicitly declare using Systaem; e.g if we need to use Console.WriteLine('');. False

  • What is the naming convention for interfaces in C# ?

    • Interfaces are camel case, prefixed with an "I". e.g. IComparable

  • When to use camelCase vs TitleCase in C#?

    • camel case only for private and local variables. Everything else is Title Case

  • How can you make sure C# throws error when a variable overflow ?

  • What is a checked block in C# ?

    • A checked block throws exception if overflow occurs for a vairbale within the block scope

  • Name all the 9 primitive types in C#.

    • bool, byte, char, short, int, long, float, double, decimal

  • What is BCL ?

    • Base class library is the standard library that comes with C#

  • What is GAC ?

    • Global assembly cache : shared libs and version on every machine that has a CLR installed. (think of globally installed npm modules). It is recommened to use shared only when required. Is it cache of Nugets ? or does the lib mean more thant Nuget ?

  • What is CoreCLR ?

    • .NET Core virtual machine, i. e. Version of CLR that comes with .NET core is called CoreCLR

  • What is CoreFX

    • Set of libraries that come with .NET Core

  • What is Roslyn ?

    • C# compiler used by dotnet tool. Compiles C# to Intermediate Level Code. Also comes as a nuget

  • What is LINQ

    • Language INtegrated Quries, indroduced in C#3.0. It adds support for declarative coding

  • Name all the types in C#.

    • class, struct, enum, interface, or delegate.

  • What is the type of int in C# ?

    • struct, class is Int32

  • How many keywords are there in C#

    • Little over hundred

  • What are contextual keyword in C# ?

    Keywords that are not reserved words. They have meaning in a context onlyw. E.g. Delegate

  • Every expression has a type in c# ? True/False ?

    • True, both variables and expressions have a type

  • Boolean, Decimal e.t.c are implemented as Classes, True/False ?

    • False, they are implemented as structs

  • What is difference between value types and reference types ?

    • Reference types are allocated space in heap while value types in stack

  • What is the result of following :

    object a = 21;
object b = 22;
Console.WriteLine(21 + 22);

  • What is the super class of Value types and Reference Types

    • System.Object

  • When we say type, is it same as class in C# ?

    • No, type are like class, interface, deleegate, struct, enum

  • On a 64 bit machine, adding of int will be faster than decimal. True/False ?

    • False (though unintuitive)

  • What is a literal value ?

    • notation that represetnts a fixed value, integer, float, binary, hexadecimal, char, string, boolean

  • What are verbatim strings in C# ?

    • used to ignore escapre characters in stings , e.g. @"c:\fileone\file-2" is equivalent to “c:\fileone\file2”

  • What is meaning of @ keyword in c# ?

    • When prefixed to a string, makes it verbatim

  • What is uint type ?

    • unsigned integer (+ve values only)

  • What is the difference between number literals that start with 0b vs 0x

    • 0b is binary and 0x is hexadecimal

  • Which is larger in C#, double.MaxValue or decimal.maxValue

    • doubles are not accuratel and double.MaxValue is larger

  • Whent to use double vs decimal ?

    • doubles should not be used when comparison is rquired. Decimal should be used for comparisons

  • What is wrong with below code ?

    pubilic bool isSalaryCorrect(employee, double approvedSalary){
  double salaray = employee.annualSalary/12;
  return approvedSalary == salaray;
}
    • doubles should not be used when we need to compare. in such cases decimal should be used.

  • What is the literal for long ?

    • L, e.g. 12121L, without L the number becomses an integer
    • No, only for local variables

  • What is default() operator ?

    • to get default value of types e.g. default(DateTime), default(int)

  • Can we use var to declare public variable ?

    • no only local variable

  • Can we disable null reference pointer in C# ?

    • yes c# allows enabling/disabling null pointer reference at projec tor file level

  • What is the 1.2M literal mean ?

    • M literal is for decimal 4.32m an d1.2M both mean decimal

  • How to write a template string in C# ?

    • quot;{variableOne} is one and {variableTwo} is two"/span>

  • How to read a line in C# ?

    • string input = Console.ReadLine()

  • Which exceptions indicates that a platform lacks the feature of C# we tried to use

    • PlatformNoSupportedException`

  • What is sbyte type ?

    • Signed Byte. byte stores 0-255 while sbyte stores -128 to 127

  • What will be result of following :

    public static DateTime? getADay(bool today){
  DateTime result = null;
  if(today){
      result = DateTime.Today;
  } else{
      result = new DateTime();
  }
  return result;
}

    DateTime is non nullable

  • What is the difference between casting and converting in C#

    when casting double to int, casting will remove teh part after . while Sytate.Convert.ToInt32() will round off

  • How can you roundof a decimal value into a long value ?

    • System.Convert.ToInt64(1.5m);

  • How can you roundof a decimal value into a long value ?

    • System.Convert.ToInt64(1.5m);

  • Show two different ways of coverting string “true” to boolean variable

    • Boolean.Parse("true"), System.Convert.ToBoolean("true")

  • How can you create and parse Base64 strings in c# ?

    • System.Convert.ToFase64String and System.Convert.FromBase64String

  • What happends if overrides is used without virtual in super class ?

    • compile error

  • Rewrite the following using shorter syntax of switch case

    switch(option){
  case 3 : 
      Console.WriteLine("it is three");
      break;
  case 1 : 
      Console.WriteLine("it is one");
      break;
  default :
      Console.WriteLine("neighter three or one");
      break;
}

    • Console.WriteLine(option switch{
  3 => "it is three",
  1 => "it is one",
  _ => "neighter three or one",
});

  • How do you create a new solution with dotnet command ?

    • dotnet new sln -o solution-name

  • How can you add a project to as reference library ?

    • dotnet add <current>.csproj reference path/to/<other>.csproj

  • What is the difference between [Fact] and [Theory] in XUnit test file ?

    • Fact is alwasy right, Theory is right for a set of data

  • What is the difference between String and string ?

    • string is a reference to Syste.String. They do exact same thing. String needs System namespace to be imported

  • what is an assembly ? is it different from a Nuget package ?

    • Package can contain multiple assemblies. Assembly are dll files stored on disk that can be used as class libraries.

  • What is the C# class for int float, short decimaland long?

    • System.Int32 - int, System.Int16 - short, Syste.Int64 -long, Syste.Decimal -decimal, System.Single - float,

  • What is .NET standard ?

    • A standard that any C# platform has to comply to . Deines what assemblies can be used on any specific platform.

  • How to create a Nuget package from the current classlib project ?

    • dotnet pack

  • How to download the dependencies of a project ?

  • dotnet restore

  • How to compile of a project ?

    • dotnet build

  • What is solution file used for ? Can a project work without a solution file ?

    • Yes, it is optional. It is used for working with multipe projects. e.g. load muliple projects in IDE by loading the solutions file or run a dotnet build command for multiple project by running in solution directory. It can also be configured for building/deploying multiple projects at once

  • Does async method run in a different thread to ensure parallelism ?

    • no, asyn await do not create additional threads

  • Which name spaces contain IO related classes ?

    • System and System.IO

  • How can I use the as expression to typecheck and typecast as the same time ?

    • if(obj is Person that)

  • Can same attribute be applied on a type more than once ?

    • Yes, if we want it with different parameters. e.g. [Conditional("DEBUG"), Conditional("TEST1")] void TraceMethod(){}

  • Consider following :

    using System;
using System.Linq;
using System.Collections.Generic;
                    
public class Program
{
    static IList<string> processed = new List<string>();
    
    public static void Main()
    {
        var input = GetInputs().Select(Transform);
        Console.WriteLine("Before : " + string.Join(", ", processed));
        Console.WriteLine("Result : " + string.Join(", ", input));
        Console.WriteLine("After  : " + string.Join(", ", processed));
    }
    static IEnumerable<string> GetInputs(){ return new List<string>(){"one", "two", "three"};}
    static string Transform(string input){ 
        string output = quot;processed-{input}";
        processed.Add(output);
        return output;
    }
}

    The output for this program is

    Before : 
Result : processed-one, processed-two, processed-three
After  : processed-one, processed-two, processed-three

    Explain what might be going on here.

    • Linq defers the funtion execution till result is consumed. So Select is not right place for side effects.

  • What will be result of following :

    using System;  
  
class SuperClass  
{     
  public void methodOne()  
  {  
    Console.WriteLine("method one from super class");  
  }  
  
  public virtual void methodTwo()  
  {  
    Console.WriteLine("method two from super class");  
  }  
}   
  
class SubClass : SuperClass  
{  
  public void methodOne()  
  {  
    Console.WriteLine("method one from sub class");  
  }  
  
  public override void methodTwo()  
  {  
    Console.WriteLine("method two from sub class");  
  }
}   
  
class Program  
{  
  static void Main(string[] args)  
  {  
    SubClass subRef  = new SubClass();  
    SuperClass superRef = subRef;

    subRef.methodOne();
    subRef.methodTwo();  
    
    superRef.methodOne();  
    superRef.methodTwo();  
  }         
}

// method one from sub class
// method two from sub class

// method one from super class
// method two from sub class
    • ‘// method one from sub class, method two from sub class, method one from super class, method two from sub class’
